section.name: Download Clirr
section.p: The latest release of Clirr is available from the Sourceforge download page.

section.name: Compile Clirr yourself
section.p: To compile Clirr yourself you need to have the following tools installed on your machine and available in the command line search path:

ul.li: Maven 2.0.9. Maven 1 no longer works and other versions of Maven 2 are currently untested.

A CVS client. If you are on Linux you probably already have that. If you are on Windows, you can use TortoiseCVS. For other platforms, please search Google for a precompiled client or build one yourself using the sources available from the CVS homepage.

section.source: cvs -d :pserver:anonymous@clirr.cvs.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/clirr login cvs -z3 -d :pserver:anonymous@clirr.cvs.sourceforge.net:/cvsroot/clirr checkout clirr cd clirr mvn package
section.p: Note that the anonymous CVS server on Sourceforge is under heavy load, and you might experience difficulties when checking out the sources. This is temporary, please try again a few minutes later.
